results.title: My life with Noel
results.creator_credit: Bess Yarram, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Bess Yarram shares the things closest to her heart. After meeting her husband in bording school, he joined the army and, from then on, the family moved with him. There was always room for one more foster child in this family but Yarram wouldn’t have been able to cope if it wasn’t for the support of the older women, the mothers and aunts that provided support and guidance.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bess Yarram, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: The Music box
results.creator_credit: Barbara Tilley, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Barbara Tilley’s moving story starts with how she and her brother moved in with her older sister, Marge, to avoid being sent to a home. Ever since that moment, Marge has been the family rock, the one keeping everyone strong through the changes and sadness and keeping the family’s spirit alive.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Barbara Tilley, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Barbara Tilley’s moving story starts with how she and her brother moved in with her older sister, Marge, to avoid being sent to a home. Ever since that moment, Marge has been the family rock, the one keeping everyone strong through the changes and sadness and keeping the family’s spirit alive.

results.title: Pitcha this : youth telling stories : Digital Storytelling project
results.creator_credit: Teialah Mason, Simone Andy, Rebecca Phillips, Nikki Butler, Lionel Austin, Kalimna Andy, Jade Colgan, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Seven Indigenous youth tell their own stories about who they are and where they come from. They proudly describe the places and people that inspire them and connect them to their heritage. In doing so, they provide an examination of what it is to grow up Indigenous in Australia in the 1990s, how to engage with your spirituality and identity today.
results.title_for_label: Pitcha this : youth telling stories : Digital Storytelling project
results.creator_credit_for_label: Teialah Mason, Simone Andy, Rebecca Phillips, Nikki Butler, Lionel Austin, Kalimna Andy, Jade Colgan, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Seven Indigenous youth tell their own stories about who they are and where they come from. They proudly describe the places and people that inspire them and connect them to their heritage. In doing so, they provide an examination of what it is to grow up Indigenous in Australia in the 1990s, how to engage with your spirituality and identity today.

They proudly describe the places and people that inspire them and connect them to their heritage. In doing so, they provide an examination of what it is to grow up Indigenous in Australia in the 1990s, how to engage with your spirituality and identity today.

results.title: Where she belongs...
results.creator_credit: Nikki Butler, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Nikki Butler pays tribute to her Nana, a strong, knowledgeable Aboriginal women. Despite being a part of the Stolen Generation and growing up away from her land, Nana has taught Butler so much about her heritage, culture and land. Butler hopes to be with her when Nana does finally return home.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Nikki Butler, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Nikki Butler pays tribute to her Nana, a strong, knowledgeable Aboriginal women. Despite being a part of the Stolen Generation and growing up away from her land, Nana has taught Butler so much about her heritage, culture and land. Butler hopes to be with her when Nana does finally return home.

results.title: Ngi bali, hello welcome
results.creator_credit: Jade Colgan, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Jade Colgan may not be easily recognised as Indigenous in Melbourne but she feels connected to her homeland up the Darling River, where she spends her family holidays. Her time there has taught Colgan that life is about laughing, learning and doing the things that help you find out who you are.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jade Colgan, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: My Nan
results.creator_credit: Teialah Mason, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Elsie Jones was a respected Aboriginal elder and a lovely woman, the kind of lady you never forget. She died when Teialah Mason was six but has left an indelible impression on her and has inspired in Mason pride in her heritage.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Teialah Mason, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: My island home
results.creator_credit: Lionel Austin, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: While Lionel Austin, has lived in Melbourne all his life, his demons reside there. Where he finds his peace is Fraser Island, a natual wonderland and, ultimately, where his heart resides.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lionel Austin, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: My Grandfather TL
results.creator_credit: Simone Andy, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Simone Andy’s fondly recalls her great-grandfather Thomas Lyon or, as he was known, Grandfather TL. A proud, strong Aboriginal man, Grandfather TL fought in the war and finally recieved his medals in 1996. His death in 1989 set Andy on a journey to find out more about her beloved great-grandfather and, ultimately, to find out who she is.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Simone Andy, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Simone Andy’s fondly recalls her great-grandfather Thomas Lyon or, as he was known, Grandfather TL. A proud, strong Aboriginal man, Grandfather TL fought in the war and finally recieved his medals in 1996. His death in 1989 set Andy on a journey to find out more about her beloved great-grandfather and, ultimately, to find out who she is.

results.title: Between generations
results.creator_credit: Rebecca Phillips, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Rebecca Phillips considers how much has changed since her mother went to school. Perhaps she could now sit at the tables and play with the other kids, but she still felt ostracised for being different. Despite this, she has learnt to be proud of her heritage and found her place in the world.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rebecca Phillips, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

Despite this, she has learnt to be proud of her heritage and found her place in the world.
